actor_awards.notes: Rita Moreno is one of the few entertainers to achieve EGOT status, winning an Oscar (1962), a Grammy (1972), a Tony (1975), and two Emmys (1977, 1978). She also received the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2004 and the Kennedy Center Honors in 2015.

filmography.title: West Side Story
filmography.role_description: The fiery and confident girlfriend of Bernardo who acts as a protective older sister figure to Maria and delivers the show-stopping number 'America'.
filmography.plot: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#51), 100 Passions (#3)

filmography.title: Singin' in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A glamorous silent film star and friend of Lina Lamont, known as the 'Zip Girl' of the screen.
filmography.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.
filmography.awards: AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#5), 100 Laughs (#16), Greatest Movie Musicals (#1)

filmography.title: The King and I
filmography.role_description: A young Burmese woman presented as a gift to the King of Siam, who is secretly in love with the man who brought her there.
filmography.plot: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.
filmography.awards: Film won 5 Oscars; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Passions (#31), Greatest Movie Musicals (#11)

filmography.title: Carnal Knowledge
filmography.role_description: A woman who becomes involved with the protagonist Jonathan in the final act of the film, enduring his misogynistic behavior.
filmography.plot: Two roommates' lives and sexual histories are chronicled from their college days through their middle age.

filmography.title: West Side Story
filmography.role_description: A re-imagining of the character Doc, Valentina is the Puerto Rican widow of the drugstore owner who serves as a mentor to Tony.
filmography.plot: An adaptation of the 1957 musical, exploring forbidden love and the rivalry between the Jets and the Sharks, two teenage street gangs of different ethnic backgrounds.
filmography.awards: Film nominated for 7 Oscars including Best Picture

filmography.title: The Ritz
filmography.role_description: A hilariously ambitious, untalented Puerto Rican bathhouse singer who mistakes a hiding mob target for a big-time producer.
filmography.plot: A man hiding from the mob takes refuge in a gay bathhouse in Manhattan, where he encounters a series of eccentric characters.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actress – Comedy or Musical (Moreno won a Tony for this role on Broadway)

filmography.title: Slums of Beverly Hills
filmography.role_description: The wealthy but troubled neighbor/relative who employs the protagonist's daughter as a nurse, adding to the family's chaotic dynamic.
filmography.plot: A teenager struggles to grow up in a lower-middle-class nomadic Jewish family that relocates every few months in 1976.

filmography.title: I Like It Like That
filmography.role_description: The opinionated mother-in-law of the protagonist who clashes with her daughter-in-law over family and lifestyle choices.
filmography.plot: A young Puerto Rican woman in the Bronx faces life struggles and family drama while trying to keep her family together.

filmography.title: The Four Seasons
filmography.role_description: An artist and one of the close-knit group of friends who vacation together, dealing with the changes in their group dynamic.
filmography.plot: Three middle-aged couples vacation together during spring, summer, autumn, and winter, navigating divorce and friendship.

filmography.title: Popi
filmography.role_description: The supportive girlfriend of a Puerto Rican widower who hatches a wild scheme to secure a better future for his sons.
filmography.plot: A poor Puerto Rican widower in New York plots to set his two sons adrift in a boat off the coast of Florida, hoping they will be rescued and adopted as Cuban refugees.

filmography.title: Marlowe
filmography.role_description: A glamorous exotic dancer who becomes a key figure in Philip Marlowe's investigation of a missing person.
filmography.plot: Private eye Philip Marlowe tries to locate the missing brother of a woman who claims to be from Kansas.

filmography.title: The Night of the Following Day
filmography.role_description: A drug-addicted stewardess involved in a kidnapping plot with Marlon Brando's character.
filmography.plot: A young woman is kidnapped and held for ransom by a group of criminals whose internal conflicts threaten to unravel their plan.

filmography.title: 80 for Brady
filmography.role_description: One of four best friends who travel to the Super Bowl to see their hero Tom Brady play, coping with recent widowhood through adventure.
filmography.plot: A group of friends made it their life-long mission to go to the Super Bowl and meet NFL superstar Tom Brady.

filmography.title: Fast X
filmography.role_description: The grandmother of Dom Toretto, providing a matriarchal presence and connection to the family's roots.
filmography.plot: Dom Toretto and his family are targeted by the vengeful son of drug kingpin Hernan Reyes.

filmography.title: Summer and Smoke
filmography.role_description: A passionate, earthy woman who represents a contrast to the repressed main character, Alma, in this Tennessee Williams adaptation.
filmography.plot: A repressed spinster falls in love with a hedonistic doctor in Mississippi.

filmography.title: Garden of Evil
filmography.role_description: A featured singer in a Mexican cantina who opens the film with a musical number.
filmography.plot: Three American soldiers of fortune are stranded in Mexico and hired by a woman to rescue her husband from a gold mine deep in Apache territory.

filmography.title: Seven Cities of Gold
filmography.role_description: A Native American woman who guides a Spanish expedition searching for the legendary cities of gold.
filmography.plot: A Spanish expedition marches into California in search of the fabled Seven Cities of Gold.

filmography.title: Casa de los Babys
filmography.role_description: The owner of a Latin American hotel where American women wait to adopt local babies.
filmography.plot: Six American women are stuck in a South American hotel while waiting for their lengthy adoption applications to process.

filmography.title: Angus
filmography.role_description: A psychic who offers advice to the titular character, a high school outcast.
filmography.plot: A teenage outcast tries to win the heart of the most popular girl in school with the help of his grandfather and a psychic.

filmography.title: Pinero
filmography.role_description: The mother of the troubled poet and playwright Miguel Piñero.
filmography.plot: The life of Nuyorican poet and playwright Miguel Piñero, whose life of poverty and drug abuse mirrored his art.
filmography.awards: ALMA Award: Nominated – Outstanding Supporting Actress

filmography.title: The Toast of New Orleans
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as a spirited young woman in this Mario Lanza musical.
filmography.plot: A rough-and-tumble bayou fisherman with a golden voice is discovered by an opera director and groomed for the stage.

filmography.title: Untamed
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the Boer trek across South Africa in this sweeping adventure film.
filmography.plot: A Dutch cavalry commander travels to Ireland to buy horses and meets a woman who later follows him to South Africa during the Boer trek.

filmography.title: Pagan Love Song
filmography.role_description: A Tahitian native in this musical romance starring Esther Williams.
filmography.plot: An American schoolteacher inherits a plantation in Tahiti and falls in love with a local woman.

filmography.title: The Vagabond King
filmography.role_description: A tavern wench who is in love with the poet-rogue Francois Villon.
filmography.plot: A poet and thief leads the vagabonds of Paris in a fight against the Duke of Burgundy to save King Louis XI.

filmography.title: Cry of Battle
filmography.role_description: A Filipino woman involved in the guerrilla resistance against the Japanese during World War II.
filmography.plot: During WWII, the son of a wealthy businessman gets involved with a guerrilla movement fighting the Japanese in the Philippines.

filmography.title: Blue Moon
filmography.role_description: A wife dealing with marital strife during a weekend getaway in the Catskills.
filmography.plot: Two couples, one older and one younger, meet at a Catskills resort and impact each other's relationships.

filmography.title: So Young, So Bad
filmography.role_description: A troubled youth in a reform school; one of Moreno's very first film appearances (credited as Rosita Moreno).
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist at a girls' reform school tries to improve the brutal conditions and help the inmates.
